data_table.description: Fatty Acid Binding Protein (FABP), Generation 3 Cohort Exam 1. Please see flag variable in order to use the correct subset of data.

variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Framingham Heart Study participant SHARe ID number

variable.name: plate
variable.description: ELISA plate ID that sample was run on
variable.comment: PLATE variable indicates date the plate was run as well as the initials of the Tech who ran it. If there were more than 1 plate run on a specific day by the same Tech, it is delineated by an A or B.

variable.name: res1
variable.description: Fatty Acid Binding Protein Result for first well(sample type: serum)
variable.comment: If RES1 was below the lowest detectable limit of 0.1 ng/ml, then RES1 was set to 0.1 ng/ml.

variable.name: res2
variable.description: Fatty Acid Binding Protein Result for second well(sample type: serum)
variable.comment: If RES2 was below the lowest detectable limit of 0.1 ng/mL, then RES2 was set to 0.1 ng/mL.
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: cvper
variable.description: Percent CV for those run in duplicate
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: fabp
variable.description: Fatty Acid Binding Protein(sample type: serum)
variable.comment: For flag = 1, 2 or 3, FABP is the same as RES1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. If FABP was below the lowest detectable limit of 0.1 ng/ml, then FABP was set to 0.1 ng/ml. FABP breaks down into the individual flag groups as follows:1.10 - 137.75 for flag = 16.67 - 214.54 for flag = 24.15 - 100.81 for flag = 318.93 - 85.42 for flag = 4.

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID numbers in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate

variable.name: phantom_id
variable.comment: Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID.
